Users should instantiate a subclass of this that implements all the
various callbacks to show the required dialogs, such as
. If no user interaction is desired (for example

passed, see each method taking a
for details.
The term ‘TCRYPT’ is used to mean ‘compatible with TrueCrypt and VeraCrypt’.
is a discontinued system for
encrypting file containers, partitions or whole disks, typically used with Windows.
is a maintained fork of TrueCrypt with various
improvements and auditing fixes.
The
protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying
instance.
The default implementation of these can be found in the protocol extension below.
For a concrete class that implements these methods and properties, see
Alternatively, use
as a lighweight,
reference if you already have an instance you just want to use.

abstract.text: provides a mechanism for interacting with the user.
It can be used for authenticating mountable operations, such as loop
mounting files, hard drive partitions or server locations. It can
also be used to ask the user questions or show a list of applications
preventing unmount or eject operations from completing.

abstract.text: that this will only have an effect on properties that are writable and not construct-only!
provides a mechanism for interacting with the user.
It can be used for authenticating mountable operations, such as loop
mounting files, hard drive partitions or server locations. It can
also be used to ask the user questions or show a list of applications
preventing unmount or eject operations from completing.
